awd_titl_txt: Building the research innovation workforce: a workshop to identify new insights and directions to advance the research computing community.
awd_abstract_narration:
The research enterprise requires a skilled research innovation workforce, consisting of highly trained and skilled practitioners in areas such as advanced cyberinfrastructure (CI), research software engineering, operations, and user support. A recent report from the National Science and Technology Council highlighted the need for this workforce. This project will conduct a series of virtual workshop sessions among a variety of affinity groups that includes academics and practioners to discuss and explore the problems and challenges affecting the growth and vitality of the research innovation workforce, and to discuss and identify potential strategies and solutions to help address these challenges. The workshop will be conducted entirely virtually with the aid of a skilled workshop facilitator. The outcomes of the proposed workshop will be a set of recommendations to the National Science Foundation related to CI professional workforce development; a better understanding of the challenges and problems affecting research innovation gleaned from discussions within and across affinity groups; and increased awareness of potentially cross-cutting strategies and solutions to encourage the growth and health of the national research innovation workforce.

The workshop seeks to facilitate a discussion among the affinity groups who collectively participate in the research enterprise, specifically targeting issues related to building and enhancing the CI professional workforce (e.g. research software engineers, research data science professionals, advanced cyberinfrastructure systems professionals, etc.) with the goal of identifying problem areas, discussing and identifying potential solutions, and developing a set of recommendations for consideration by the national research community and the NSF. The workshop co-chairs and steering committee represent a broad group of stakeholders. The primary goal of the proposed workshop is to explore the challenges and potential strategies and solutions to address the need for an advanced CI research innovation workforce that is essential to advancing the frontiers of computational and data-intensive scientific research. The workshop will result in a report with recommendations for fostering growth and career paths for a diverse, inclusive, and emerging set of professionals that collaborates across traditional boundaries and enables research and education.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
The workshop co-chairs organized and conducted a virtual workshop that was held in August 2020 and September 2020 across three virtual sessions. The virtual workshop sought to bring together individuals from the research computing community to explore the issues and challenges that affect the cyberinfrastructure/research computing and data (CI/RCD) workforce that helps to develop, deploy, and operate research computing and cyberinfrastructure resources for the research community. 

During the virtual workshop, workshop participants identified a set of thematic challenges that affect the CI/RCD workforce. To provide guidance to the community related to these challenges, workshop participants generated a list of recommendations.  The virtual workshop, thematic challenges identified during the workshop, and the list of recommendations generated by workshop participants are described in a workshop report.  Additionally, a paper describing the workshop was also published in the 2022 Practice & Experience in Advanced Research Computing (PEARC 2022) conference that was held in July, 2022. 

The summary of a partial list of thematic challenges and cross-cutting issues that affect the CI/RCD workforce that were identified during the workshop includes: questions and issues related to the need to address the inclusion and diversity of the workforce; the need for clarity in the definitions of roles and career paths within the workforce; the awareness of the workforce environment as an ecosystem; the effects of the organizational position of research computing within an institution; the need for continued workforce training; and the need for better communication to stakeholders.  A detailed list of the thematic challenges is described in the workshop report and is summarized in the PEARC 2022 paper.

The summary of a partial list of recommendations identified by workshop participants includes: the need for a coordinating "umbrella" effort than spans the current groups across the community; the need for a common collection of job descriptions and roles across the community; creating a census to collect current information on the CI/RCD workforce; improving communications from the community to stakeholders and leadership; and developing an inclusion, equity, and diversity plan with the involvement of individuals with expertise in equity, inclusion, and diversity. A detailed list of the recommendations identified during the workshop is described in the workshop report and is summarized in the PEARC 2022 paper.
